ygData.subject: Re: [EQ-Quest] EQ bugs
ygData.msgSnippet: I love all the happy people in this world.  To help ya out a little Matt, anyone caught using a known bug or taking advantage of any bug to advance their
ygData.messageBody:
I love all the happy people in this world. To help ya out a little Matt,
anyone caught using a known 'bug' or taking advantage of any 'bug' to
advance their experience, position or wealth are subject to immediate
banishment. That means the Gods will turn off your account - permanently.
If anyone on this list had any clue or knowledge of active 'bugs' in the
game they sure wouldn't talk about it in an open forum such as this. You
should take a few minutes and actually read that "I accept" form you have to
click past every time you log into the game. And Stookey, your probably a
nice person but you really need to chill. <grin> I bet everyone who reads
this list has wanted to ask that same question but just in different terms
at one time during the beginning of their days. Heck, I always wanted to
know how I could get 'tweaked' until I found out that you had to know
someone and realized I didn't know anyone more than 2 levels above me.

----- Original Message -----
From: "Stookey" <stookey@...>
To: <EQ-Quest@egroups.com>
Sent: Thursday, January 25, 2001 4:24 PM
Subject: RE: [EQ-Quest] EQ bugs


> There is that one bug where you kill a bunch of monsters and get exp,
other
> than that maybe you should pull your thumb out of your ass and go play the
> game and stop looking for the easy way out. Jackass.
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: MattManE_99@... [mailto:MattManE_99@...]
> Sent: Thursday, January 25, 2001 3:53 PM
> To: EQ-Quest@egroups.com
> Subject: [EQ-Quest] EQ bugs
>
>
> Can anyone tell me if they know of any bugs in EQ? I need exp to gain
> a couple of levels to get new spells. Thanks, I appreciate it.
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
